meanings.sent1: The farmer inherited an alodia from his grandfather, giving him full control over the land.
meanings.sent2: The alodia passed down through generations, ensuring the family's complete ownership of the property.
meanings.sent3: The alodia was like a treasure chest, holding all the farmer's dreams and hopes for the future.
meanings.sent4: Her alodia was her kingdom, where she ruled with fairness and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The alodia stood proudly, a symbol of freedom and autonomy in a changing world.

meanings.definition: A form of land tenure in which land is held free of any rent or service due to the lord.
meanings.sent1: In the alodia system, the farmers worked the land without owing anything to the lord.
meanings.sent2: The alodia granted them the right to cultivate the fields without any obligations to the landowner.
meanings.sent3: The alodia made the neighboring lords jealous, as they still collected fees from their tenants.
meanings.sent4: The alodia was a shield protecting the farmers from the demands of the lord.
meanings.sent5: Under the alodia arrangement, the farmers flourished without the burden of rent or services owed.

meanings.definition: A type of property ownership in which the owner has full and independent control over the land.
meanings.sent1: The alodia title deed was a document proving the owner's complete authority over the land.
meanings.sent2: With the alodia in hand, the landowner could make decisions without seeking approval from anyone else.
meanings.sent3: The alodia ownership made the owner feel like a king of their domain.
meanings.sent4: She cherished her alodia, knowing it was a rare gift of autonomy in a world of restrictions.
meanings.sent5: The alodia ownership was a badge of honor, signifying true independence and control over one's destiny.
